posts.author: Dante2377
posts.content:
so with the old builds from comcast lost into the ether (though if you know what you're searching for it's all cached), I thought I post a Str-based PM fighter to the lvl 40 section.  Posting here for any feedback prior.

This was based on Grizz's two PM builds, Myrmidon Eternal and Charnel Lord.  I always felt there was a bit too much PM, which led to not enough AB (42 and 40 respectively).  So I give you this:

Fighter(20), Bard(4), Pale Master(16), Human

STR: 18 (34)
DEX: 10
CON: 14
WIS: 8
INT: 14
CHA: 8

Hitpoints: 463
Skillpoints: 223
Saving Throws (Fortitude/Will/Reflex): 28/23/21
Saving Throw bonuses: Spells: +8
BAB: 28
AB (max, naked): 44 (melee), 29 (ranged)
AC (naked/mundane armor/shield only): 28/39
Spell Casting: 
Alignment Changes: 0

Disable Trap 1(3), Discipline 43(55), Open Lock 1(1), Perform 10(9), Spellcraft 41(43), Taunt 41(40), Tumble 40(40), UMD 41(40), remaining skillpoints 3


So you get good HP, nice AB of 44, Discipline, Spellcraft, Taunt, Tumble, UMD, 13 pts AC better than standard strength-based tumble-dump build (+10 PM, +5 EMA dodge, -2 no armor skin), hearty strength damage + WS/EWS, and pretty much every general combat feat worth taking (IKD, BF, IC, expertise+taunt combo, great cleave, room for disarm/imp disarm if you want it).  You even have a baby bard song for 40 rounds per day (60 if Lingering Song taken).  

Some options:
- Take two-handed weapon.  If so, you'll probably want to swap out one of the saving throw feats for disarm and take improved disarm at 18.  
- Dev Crit - swap out 2 Great Str for OC and DC.  
- on a high magic PW, EWS may not be worth it (I've played on worlds where you can get all 12 damage bonuses on weapons).  If the 4 damage is not worth it in your environment, you can either A. take Armor Skin for another 2 AC or B. move two fighter levels from epic to pre-epic in place of the two PM levels, bumping your AB to 45 (at that point either take disarm/imp disarm or two SF taunt and discipline).  

comments/feedback before I post it to the level 40 section?

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
I like this kind of builds. The crit immunity granted by PM cries out for dev crit. And you have gone half the way already by taking Great cleave.
Pre epic I would have taken expertise earlier, perhaps at lvl 2, WF at lvl 3, WS at lvl 5 and KD at lvl 7 when you start to get 2 attacks per round. I would drop one feat to be able to take the disarm feats, either Lightning reflexes or Great fortitude. The fort saves are not quite as important as usual in a dev crit build, because you have crit immunity from PM.
In epic levels you are feat starved if you want to retain AB44 with 6 Great strength feats. One solution is to make a F24 Ba6 PM10 build. That will give you EWF, EP, EWS, Dev crit and AS, but you lose EMA and EW.
